page.title: 09St Edward's school
page.content: St. Edward's school is an independent special school for 80 boys from 12 to 17 years of age. The main buildings are in Melchet court, a mansion built in the 19th century. The school is surrounded by parkland and farmland which used to be part of Lord Melchet's estate. As well as the usual school subjects the boys at St. Edwards can learn carpentry, brickwork, decorating, horticulture and the care of horses. The boys on the last course are responsible for the care of a string of ponies and horses. These are used by many of the boys who belong to the pony club.The school is very well equipped with workshops, a sports hall and indoor swimming pool. As well as sports the boys take part in a range of activities such as model-making, mechanics, electronics and camping.
